introduction.paragraph1: This page and any pages it links to explains {{-link}} terms of use.
introduction.paragraph2: You must agree to these to use {{-link}}.

whoWeAre.paragraph1: {{-link}} are operated by the Planning Inspectorate.
whoWeAre.paragraph2: The Planning Inspectorate is a government agency.
whoWeAre.paragraph3: If you have questions about our service please {{-link}}.

usingNIP.paragraph1: You agree to use {{-link}} only for lawful purposes. You must also use it in a way that does not infringe the rights of, or restrict or inhibit the use and enjoyment of, this site by anyone else.
usingNIP.paragraph2: We update {{-link}} all the time. We can change or remove content at any time without notice.

servicesAndTransactions.paragraph1: You can use {{-link}} to access online government services and transactions, for example 'register to have your say'.

linkingToNIP.paragraph1: We welcome and encourage other websites to link to {{-link}}.
linkingToNIP.paragraph2: However we will not give permission to:
linkingToNIP.listItem1: charge your website's users to click on a link to any page on {{-link}}
linkingToNIP.listItem2: say your website is associated with or endorsed by {{-link}} or another government department or agency

linkingFromNIP.paragraph1: {{-link}} links to websites that are managed by other government departments and agencies, service providers or other organisations. We do not have any control over the content on these websites.
linkingFromNIP.listItem1: the protection of any information you give to these websites
linkingFromNIP.listItem2: any loss or damage that may come from your use of these websites, or any other websites they link to
linkingFromNIP.paragraph3: You agree to release us from any claims or disputes that may come from using these websites.
linkingFromNIP.paragraph4: You should read all terms and conditions, privacy policies and end user licences that relate to these websites before you use them.

usingNIPContent.paragraph1: Some content is exempt from the OGL - check the {{-link}}.
usingNIPContent.paragraph2: Departmental logos and crests are also exempt from the OGL, except when they form an integral part of a document or dataset.
usingNIPContent.paragraph3: If any content is not subject to Crown copyright protection or published under the OGL, we'll usually credit the author or copyright holder.
usingNIPContent.paragraph4: We do not authorise the use or republishing of third party documents without the permission of the original intellectual property holder.
usingNIPContent.paragraph5: This covers all material not owned by {{-link}} including those created by applicants, interested parties or interested groups.
usingNIPContent.paragraph6: If you have questions about republishing any content on our service please {{-link}}.
usingNIPContent.paragraph7: {{-link}} if you want to reproduce a piece of content but are not sure if it's covered by Crown copyright or the OGL.
usingNIPContent.paragraph8: We make most of the content on {{-link}} available through feeds for other websites and applications to use. The websites and applications that use our feeds are not our products, and they might use versions of our content that have been edited and stored for later use ('cached').
usingNIPContent.paragraph9: We do not give any guarantees, conditions or warranties about the accuracy or completeness of any content used by these products. We're not liable for any loss or damage that may come from your use of these products.
usingNIPContent.paragraph10: The most up to date version of our content will always be on {{-link}}.

disclaimer.paragraph1: This section does not reduce or remove our responsibilities or people's rights concerning data protection in any manner.
disclaimer.paragraph2: While we make every effort to keep {{-link}} up to date, we do not provide any guarantees, conditions or warranties that the information will be:
disclaimer.paragraph3: We do not publish advice on {{-link}}. You should get professional or specialist advice before doing anything on the basis of the content.
disclaimer.paragraph4: We're not liable for any loss or damage that may come from using {{-link}}. This includes:
disclaimer.listItem6: any direct, indirect or consequential losses
disclaimer.listItem7: any loss or damage caused by civil wrongs ('tort', including negligence), breach of contract or otherwise
disclaimer.listItem8: the use of {{-link}} and any websites that are linked to or from it
disclaimer.listItem9: the inability to use {{-link}} and any websites that are linked to or from it
disclaimer.paragraph5: This applies if the loss or damage was foreseeable, arose in the normal course of things or you advised us that it might happen.
disclaimer.paragraph6: This includes (but is not limited to) the loss of your:
disclaimer.listItem19: intangible property, including loss, corruption or damage to data or any computer system
disclaimer.paragraph7: We may still be liable for:
disclaimer.listItem21: death or personal injury arising from our negligence
disclaimer.listItem23: any other liability which cannot be excluded or limited under applicable law

requestsToRemoveContent.paragraph1: You can ask for content to be removed from {{-link}}. Please note the National Infrastructure process is governed by the principle of openness. If you request for content to be removed, in the interest of fairness, it will usually not be taken into consideration by the Examining Authority.
requestsToRemoveContent.listItem1: in order to comply with data protection legislation covering the rights and freedoms of individuals
requestsToRemoveContent.listItem2: if it breaches copyright laws, contains sensitive personal data or material that may be considered obscene or defamatory
requestsToRemoveContent.paragraph3: {{-link}} to ask for content to be removed. You'll need to send us the web address (URL) of the content and explain why you think it should be removed. We'll reply to let you know whether we'll remove it.
requestsToRemoveContent.paragraph4: We remove content at our discretion in discussion with the department or agency responsible for it. You can still request information under the {{-link}}

informationAboutYou.heading1: Information about you and your visits to National Infrastructure Projects
informationAboutYou.phrase1: We collect information about you in accordance with our {{-link}}
informationAboutYou.paragraph1: By using National Infrastructure Projects, you agree to us collecting this information and confirm that any data you provide is accurate.

virusProtection.paragraph1: We make every effort to check and test {{-link}} for viruses at every stage of production.
virusProtection.paragraph2: You must make sure that the way you use {{-link}} does not expose you to the risk of viruses, malicious computer code or other forms of interference which can damage your computer system.
virusProtection.paragraph3: We're not responsible for any loss, disruption or damage to your data or computer system that might happen when you use {{-link}}.

offences.paragraph1: When using {{-link}}, you must not introduce viruses, trojans, worms, logic bombs or any other material that's malicious or technologically harmful.
offences.paragraph2: You must not try to gain unauthorised access to {{-link}}, the server on which it's stored or any server, computer or database connected to it.
offences.paragraph3: You must not attack {{-link}} in any way. This includes denial-of-service attacks.
offences.paragraph4: We'll report any attacks or attempts to gain unauthorised access to {{-link}} to the relevant law enforcement authorities and share information about you with them.

governingLaw.paragraph1: These terms and conditions are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales.
governingLaw.paragraph2: Any dispute you have which relates to these terms and conditions, or your use of {{-link}} (whether it be contractual or non-contractual), will be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.

general.paragraph1: There may be legal notices elsewhere on {{-link}} that relate to how you use the site.
general.paragraph2: We're not liable if we fail to comply with these terms and conditions because of circumstances beyond our reasonable control.
general.paragraph3: We might decide not to exercise or enforce any right available to us under these terms and conditions. We can always decide to exercise or enforce that right at a later date.
general.paragraph4: Doing this once will not mean we automatically waive the right on any other occasion.
general.paragraph5: If any of these terms and conditions are held to be invalid, unenforceable or illegal for any reason, the remaining terms and conditions will still apply.

changesToTerms.heading1: Changes to these terms and conditions
changesToTerms.paragraph1: Please check these terms and conditions regularly. We can update them at any time without notice.
changesToTerms.paragraph2: You'll agree to any changes if you continue to use National Infrastructure Projects after the terms and conditions have been updated.
